definition: The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River, proletarian novel by Ding Ling, winner of 1951 Stalin prize
pinyin: Tai4 yang2 Zhao4 Zai4 Sang1 gan1 He2 Shang4

definition: according to/in accordance with/to shine/to illuminate/to reflect/to look at (one's reflection)/to take (a photo)/photo/as requested/as before
(located) at/(to be) in/to exist/in the middle of doing sth/(indicating an action in progress)
tree trunk/main part of sth/to manage/to work/to do/capable/cadre/to kill (slang)/to fuck (vulgar)
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
Yao Xueyin (1910-1999), PRC novelist, author of historical novel Li Zicheng 李自成
Camel Xiangzi, novel by Lao She 老舍
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Ru Zhijuan (1925-1998), female novelist and politician
Feng Deying (1935-), socialist realist novelist, author of Bitter cauliflower 苦菜花[ku3 cai4 hua1] (1954)
Guo Xiaochuan (1919-1976), PRC communist poet, hero in the war with Japan, died after long persecution during Cultural Revolution
Li Yingru (1913-1989), calligrapher and writer, author of many novels about the war as seen by the communists
Tian Han (1898-1968), author of the words of the PRC national anthem March of the Volunteer Army 義勇軍進行曲|义勇军进行曲
